main event: Multiple UFO sightings were reported in Fort Thomas, Kentucky and Bavina, Ohio in October 1956. These included a large, stationary, metallic gray object observed in Kentucky and a bright, round, stationary object hovering above a bridge in Ohio.
interesting points: The object observed in Kentucky did not display wings or a tail and was concluded to be possibly astronomical or unknown.
The object observed in Ohio was described as soundless, round, and about 30-40 feet in diameter, with the witness being an ex-member of the U.S. Air Force and a licensed private pilot.
The witnessed event in Ohio lasted approximately 10 minutes before the object accelerated at a high rate of speed and disappeared from sight.
The witness in Ohio was unable to photograph the object due to being too excited and surprised by the experience.

The report also mentions the involvement of the Civilian Research, Interplanetary Flying Objects organization and the request for special instructions or comments from Captain G. E. Gregory of the U.S. Air Force.
sighted object: A large, metallic gray object in Kentucky and a bright, round, stationary object hovering above a bridge in Ohio
location: Fort Thomas, Kentucky and Bavina, Ohio
witnesses: An employee of a local General Electric Co. plant and an ex-member of the U.S. Air Force and licensed private pilot
